Though I'm already convinced of Umami's deliciousness, I need to get back for their namesake ramen, their green tea cr√®me brulee (yes), and what I hear is an excellent brunch.

My wife and I go out for lunch a lot.  We do not live in the city which makes it hard for us to enjoy dinner there.  Umami is only open for dinner.  We happened to be in town a bit later yesterday and went to try them out.  This place has always intrigued us.  Not any more! We each ordered a plate of dumplings.  She had a plate of six vegan and I had nine pork.  We split a summer roll as an appetizer.  We enjoyed our drink and the roll.  It went downhill from there.  About 15 minutes or so after we finished our appetizer, our waiter stops by to tell us that they accidently served one of our entrees to another table and if we could choose another appetizer, on them, to nibble while they recooked our meal.  He served us our free App.  After another 15 min or so after we finished, someone shows with our food.  THey served me the six dumpling plate when I ordered nine.  I mentioned that to the girl and she said she would tell my waiter.  When I was about half done with my plate, the waiter stops be and I mentioned this again to him.  He finally shows up with my other three dumplings about 20 minutes after I finished the original six!   I denied the other three and asked they be removed from the bill so we could get out of there.  A manager never showed his/her face. The intrigue is gone.  We have lived and eaten in the Madison for ten years and have NEVER gotten worst service as we did last night.  No, We will never return.

I've been here twice, and both times I thought the ramen was just alright. But I love this place simply for the drinks and the beef and pork buns and dumplings. I could go just to eat appetizers. I do wish the ramen was a little more flavorful, but overall it's a cool place and the inside has a very nice and hip atmosphere.

I had previously heard great things about this place, so I had some pretty high expectations going in. And, while the restaurant was hip and fun and made me feel cooler than cool just by being there, the food wasn't anything I was about to write home to mama about. :/  I got the vegetarian option and it was fine, but I also think I would've been happier (and richer) if I'd just made some ramen noodles at home. My ramen was also smaller than I thought it'd be for the price ($12) and came out slightly cold (but it also might be that I just like everything to be scorching hot?).  Sooooo overall, the ramen wasn't anything special and I really don't think I will be back anytime soon. It was fine, but your girl is in college and she's too broke to pay $12 for a 15 cent packet.   Btw i am not a ramen expert by any means, so take that as ya will
Four of us went there.  Edamame appetizer, pork buns, ramen ... everyone enjoyed their meal. Definitely will go again.

Not sure how anyone could give this place more than 2 stars.  The ramen is definitely not made fresh.  The broth is heavy, the noodles weren't boiled long enough, the braised pork had freezer burn taste and the eggs still had ice in the yolk.
Forgot the mushrooms on my wife's mushroom arugula salad. The rice in my burrito was still hard. Bland. I would not go back. Our waitress, Megan, was nice.

I used to live in Okinawa, and have been trying to find authentic tasting ramen here. Although still not quite the same as japan, this place has the most delicious ramen I've found so far. The ambience is nice, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is great. Try the pork buns, you won't be dissapointed.

MMMMM Umami!   When this place opened, it took me a long time to try it. Not sure why. Maybe the location and parking? Maybe because it's in what appears to be an old single family home converted to a restaurant? Who knows. All I do know is, I should have just gone because when I finally did, I was so impressed.   First visit we sat at the bar for dinner. Our bartender was great. Chatty and attentive but not in your face. We both ordered ramen, different kinds. SO. GOOD. I am pretty picky with ramen. Texture of eggs, ingredients thrown in, the flavoring - it was all perfect. I was really happy with my selection.   My second visit was for brunch. I wasn't sure what the menu would have for brunch as I typically only associate ramen and the like with dinner. We had bacon dumplings, the omurice (rice omelette) and the biscuits and tonkotsu gravy. Everything was really good!   I definitely recommend Umami!
I'd compare the pork buns to those we had at Momofuku Saam Bar in NYC.  We also like the dumplings but the ramen not so much.
